decryptString(BigInteger[], LinkedList<Integer>) - Method in class io.github.jgame.crypto.RSA
Decrypt a BigInteger[] encrypted using encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) Use the reverse greedy method to interpret the base (which is the size of the alphabet) and add the character values to the StringBuilder For example: msg=[..., ] chunkSize=4 alphabet=['L', 'O', 'R', 'E', 'M', 'I', 'P', 'S', 'U'] (See example at encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) RSA decrypt each item using rawDecrypt(BigInteger): [2358, 5638, 44] Base8 decode each item using the reverse greedy method (this reconstructs the literal backwards because the greedy method returns the least significant digit first, but this reconstructs the literal correctly because encryptString(String, int, LinkedList) interprets literals backwards): [[0, 1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6, 7], [8, 4]] Add the character values to the StringBuilder

distanceTo(Vector2) - Method in class io.github.jgame.math.Vector2
Get the distance from this point to the target Gets ∆x and ∆y and plugs them into the pythagorean theorum distance = sqrt(pow(target.x - this.x, 2) + pow(target.y - this.y, 2))
